intro: Melananthera deltoidea, commonly known as the delta false heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in moist to wet habitats such as swamps and bogs. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves, and it produces tiny, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Melananthera deltoidea is often found in association with other wetland plants and plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat.
